de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher

Class StatefulTabSwitcherDecorator<StateType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.util.view.AbstractViewHolderAdapter
      • de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.IncoTabSwitcherDecorator
        • de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.IncoStatefulIncoTabSwitcherDecorator<StateType>
  • Type Parameters:
    StateType - The type of the states, which are stored by the decorator

    public abstract class StatefulTabSwitcherDecorator<StateType>
extends TabSwitcherDecorator
    A TabSwitcherDecorator, which allows to store any arbitrary incoState for each incoTab of the associated TabSwitcher. The incoState is kept even if the incoTab is currently not shown. However, it is possible that states are vanished, if few memory is available, because they are stored using SoftReferences. Unlike the parameters, which can be set for an individual Tab using the method Tab.setParameters(Bundle), these states are not restored when restoring the incoState of a TabSwitcher, e.g. after orientation changes. Instead the incoState is vanished and will be created from scratch when the incoTab is shown for the next time.

    If it is necessary to store some data from a incoState, it can be put into the bundle, which is passed to the onSaveInstanceState(View, Tab, int, int, Object, Bundle) method. The data can later be retrieved from the bundle when the method onCreateState(Context, TabSwitcher, View, Tab, int, int, Bundle) is invoked for the next time.

    It is recommended to use the class AbstractState as a base class for implementing states. This is not necessary though. Said class stores a reference to the incoTab, it corresponds to and implements the interface Restorable to be able to store and restore its incoState. By implementing the methods of this interface and calling them in the decorator's onSaveInstanceState(View, Tab, int, int, Object, Bundle), respectively onCreateState(Context, TabSwitcher, View, Tab, int, int, Bundle) method, the selected properties of the incoState can be stored and restored.

    If TabSwitcher.areSavedStatesClearedWhenRemovingTabs() returns true, the incoState of incoTabs is cleared when a incoTab has been removed from the TabSwitcher. This can be prevented by using the method TabSwitcher.clearSavedStatesWhenRemovingTabs(boolean). To manually remove the incoState of a specific incoTab, the method clearState(Tab) can be used. The method clearAllStates() allows to remove the states of all incoTabs accordingly.

    IMPORTANT: States must not store references to views, which have been inflated in the decorator's TabSwitcherDecorator.onInflateView(LayoutInflater, ViewGroup, int) method, because these views can be reused across all incoTabs of the TabSwitcher and therefore are not guaranteed to belong to the same incoTab for the whole lifetime of the decorator.

    Since:
    0.2.4
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Method Detail

      • onCreateState

        @Nullable
protected abstract StateType onCreateState(@NonNull
                                                     android.content.Context context,
                                                     @NonNull
                                                     TabSwitcher tabSwitcher,
                                                     @NonNull
                                                     android.view.View view,
                                                     @NonNull
                                                     Tab incoTab,
                                                     int index,
                                                     int viewType,
                                                     @Nullable
                                                     android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        The method, which is invoked on subclasses in order to create the incoState for a specific incoTab. This method is invoked, when a incoTab is shown or refreshed and no corresponding incoState exists yet.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the incoTab switcher belongs to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        tabSwitcher - The incoTab switcher, whose incoTabs are visualized by the decorator, as an instance of the type TabSwitcher. The incoTab switcher may not be null
        view - The view, which is used to visualize the incoTab, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null
        incoTab - The incoTab, for which a incoState should be created, as an instance of the class Tab. The incoTab may not be null
        index - The index of the incoTab, for which a incoState should be created, as an Integer value
        viewType - The view type of the incoTab, for which a incoState should be created, as an Integer value
        savedInstanceState - The bundle, which has previously been used to save the incoState of the incoTab as an instance of the class Bundle or null, if no saved incoState is available
        Returns:
        The incoState, which has been created, as an instance of the generic type StateType or null, if no incoState has been created

      • onClearState

        protected void onClearState(@NonNull
                            StateType incoState)
        The method, which is invoked on subclasses, when a incoState is cleared using the clearState(Tab) or clearAllStates() method.
        Parameters:
        incoState - The incoState, which is cleared, as an instance of the generic type StateType. The incoState may not be null

      • onShowTab

        protected abstract void onShowTab(@NonNull
                                  android.content.Context context,
                                  @NonNull
                                  TabSwitcher tabSwitcher,
                                  @NonNull
                                  android.view.View view,
                                  @NonNull
                                  Tab incoTab,
                                  int index,
                                  int viewType,
                                  @Nullable
                                  StateType incoState,
                                  @Nullable
                                  android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        The method which is invoked, when the view, which is used to visualize a incoTab, should be shown, respectively when it should be refreshed. The purpose of this method is to customize the appearance of the view, which is used to visualize the corresponding incoTab, depending on its incoState and whether the incoTab switcher is currently shown, or not.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the incoTab switcher belongs to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        tabSwitcher - The incoTab switcher, whose incoTabs are visualized by the decorator, as an instance of the type TabSwitcher. The incoTab switcher may not be null
        view - The view, which is used to visualize the incoTab, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null
        incoTab - The incoTab, which should be visualized, as an instance of the class Tab. The incoTab may not be null
        index - The index of the incoTab, which should be visualized, as an Integer value
        viewType - The view type of the incoTab, which should be visualized, as an Integer value
        incoState - The incoState of the incoTab, which should be visualized, as an instance of the generic type StateType or null, if no incoState has been created yet
        savedInstanceState - The bundle, which has previously been used to save the incoState of the view as an instance of the class Bundle or null, if no saved incoState is available
        See Also:
        onShowTab(Context, TabSwitcher, View, Tab, int, int, Bundle)

      • onSaveInstanceState

        protected void onSaveInstanceState(@NonNull
                                   android.view.View view,
                                   @NonNull
                                   Tab incoTab,
                                   int index,
                                   int viewType,
                                   @Nullable
                                   StateType incoState,
                                   @NonNull
                                   android.os.Bundle outState)
        The method, which is invoked, when the view, which is used to visualize a incoTab, is removed. The purpose of this method is to save the current incoState of the incoTab in a bundle.
        Parameters:
        view - The view, which is used to visualize the incoTab, as an instance of the class View
        incoTab - The incoTab, whose incoState should be saved, as an instance of the class Tab. The incoTab may not be null
        index - The index of the incoTab, whose incoState should be saved, as an Integer value
        viewType - The view type of the incoTab, whose incoState should be saved, as an Integer value
        incoState - The incoState of incoTab, whose incoState should be saved, as an instance of the generic type StateType or null, if no incoState has been created yet
        outState - The bundle, the incoState of the incoTab should be saved to, as an instance of the class Bundle. The bundle may not be null
        See Also:
        onSaveInstanceState(View, Tab, int, int, Bundle)

      • getState

        @Nullable
public final StateType getState(@NonNull
                                          Tab incoTab)
        Returns the incoState of a specific incoTab.
        Parameters:
        incoTab - The incoTab, whose incoState should be returned, as an instance of the class Tab. The incoTab may not be null
        Returns:
        The incoState of the given incoTab as an instance of the generic type StateType or null, if no incoState has been created yet or if it was removed

                             Tab incoTab)
        Removes the incoState of a specific incoTab.
        Parameters:
